repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript contains a ballad (ammāṉai) on the Catholic saint Margaret, called in Tamil Marikarutammāḷ. It tells the story of her life, conversion to Christianity, and death. The author is unknown, but the texts likely dates to the 18th century.

filiation.p: This texts exists in multiple manuscript and printed versions (see the bibliography below for some of the printed editions).

msItem.incipit:
cīrāru ñāṉacciṟantōṉai neñcil vaittup
pārārum vāḻap pakarnturaittēṉ ammāṉai
muṉṉavaṉē yēka mukaṉai mukivillāṉē
taṉṉikarillā tapāṉa tāṉāyiruppōṉē
vantu taṉṉ ikkataikku vākuṟa nal vākkaruḷum
entaic caṟuvēcuraṉē yevvuyirkataṅ kaṟtāvē
msItem.explicit:
kaṟṟa vitai pēcukiṟāḷ kaṇṭīrō yeṉa capaiyil
uṟṟirukkum pēr periya uṇmaiyuḷḷa vittakarē
eṉṟu mukam viṭimiyēntala mikacciṉnatu

extent.measure: 1-33 numbered folios, folios 1-27 are inscribed, folios 28-33 are numbered but otherwise blank.

collation.desc: The front cover had a sticker of the BnF with the current classification (Indien 486). The back cover has on the inside some numbers in white chalk : 66 bis 46 3.
The manuscript is fairly simple: it is constituted by one unit single unit containing the (incomplete) text and several blank but numbered folios.

supportDesc.foliation: Original Tamil foliation in Tamil numerals on the left margin. Folios 1-18 are inscribed and inked; folios 19-27 are inscribed but not inked; folios 28-33 are numbered but otherwise blank.
The scribed corrected the page number on several instances (for instance, on fol. 17, fol. 19, fol. 20).
supportDesc.condition: Overall good conditions ; signs of humidity ; fol. 25 is chipped.

handNote.desc: The same scribe seems to have copied the entire manuscript; she sometimes used the double-curled kompu for long vowels ō and ē, but more often they remain unmarked.

additions.desc: folio 1r: nº 24 This is the shelfmark given according to the list of manuscript compiled by Velanguani Arokium (Vēḷāṅkaṉṉi Ārōkkiyam) (NAF 5443, folio 4r).

folio 1r:
canta marikarutāḷ taṉmaccarittirattai paintamiḻāl ammāṉaip
pāṭutaṟkum intaraiya-l āraṇattaik kāṭṭa maṉuvāki tuyarpūṇ
maṟantēraṉa kāraṇamām - poracciluvai kāppu

folio 1v:
ceyya marikarutāḷ cīrciṟanta kātai nalam - vaiyyakattir - pāvāy - vaḻaṅkutaṟkku tuyyatava
paṉṉiraṇṭu - maṉṉar kula paintoṭiyāṅ kaṟpu niṟai kaṉṉimari porr(or: rā)ppatame kāppu.

origin.origDate: The ms. is not dated, but since it was included in the hand-written list that Velanguani Arokium (Vēḷāṅkaṉṉi Ārōkkiyam) compiled in 1845, we know this is the date ante quem it arrived in Paris.
